channel.title: Pokemon Multiplayer Red
channel.description:
Hi. This is a game I've been working on for the past couple months. It's not done, nor is it multiplayer yet, but it's making great progress. It's a nearly-perfect clone Pokemon Red/Blue, but it will be co-opable, so the original game but with a friend. :D
It's written in C++ and uses SFML, so it's cross-platform. All of the data comes from the original games, so it's incredibly accurate. Here is some media.
[img]https://pbs.twimg.com/media/BosYGnTCIAAnuld.png[/img] [img]https://pbs.twimg.com/media/BomEv6XCUAAHHiP.png[/img] [img]https://pbs.twimg.com/media/BoWebLnCYAIKl4D.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/o5Y4vGT.gif[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/YJto3UJ.gif[/img] [youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R371twTKh5w[/youtube] [youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gTjzbHVFWkw[/youtube]
It has a full scripting system, using my own quick command-based language for it. It allows for blocking operations, like getting input from the player. No multi-threading. The compiler for it is also written in C++ (In the repository under PMRS)
[url=https://github.com/lin20/projectpmr]Source Code[/url] [url=http://projectpmr.blogspot.com/]Blog[/url] (Mainly for to-do lists and feature discussions) [url=https://twitter.com/ProgrammerLin]My Twitter[/url] (For frequent updates) [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwPZQd1nMPX5JZoD7UxVT4A]My YouTube Channel[/url] (For feature demonstrations)
One day I will be looking for people to help with scripting. A lot of them will be automatically generated and dumped, but all of the events will be remade by hand.
~Lin

item.title: Pokemon Multiplayer Red
item.dc:creator: @Driman_Rune Driman Rune
item.description:
@Driman_Rune wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:24, topic:543679”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=662560.msg4477130#msg4477130 date=1426651634]
Hey Lin. You still working on this? Would love to see how its been going. Also, why stop at co-op? What’s preventing you from going MMO-esque?
[/quote]Unfortunately, no, it’s on hiatus, but the repo is public. I’d like to see it finished too but C::W is my priority. And I’m stopping at co-op because there are already enough MMOs out there and this was written to basically be singleplayer but with another person.[/quote]

Aww.

I loved the work, this is inspiring me to learn c++.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:23, topic:543679”]Hey Lin. You still working on this? Would love to see how its been going. Also, why stop at co-op? What’s preventing you from going MMO-esque?[/quote]Unfortunately, no, it’s on hiatus, but the repo is public. I’d like to see it finished too but C::W is my priority. And I’m stopping at co-op because there are already enough MMOs out there and this was written to basically be singleplayer but with another person.

item.title: Pokemon Multiplayer Red
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I’ve been ROM hacking, as it’s called, since almost the start of my programming career. I have a great knowledge regarding Gameboy/Color editing, data finding, debugging, and programming. I just know how to find stuff after lots of getting my hands dirty.

Read full topic

item.title: Pokemon Multiplayer Red
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:20, topic:543679”][quote author=wildskiller link=topic=662560.msg4463058#msg4463058 date=1418591167]
Are you decoding the data from Pokemon Red rom file?
[/quote]I dump the data from ROMs, yes. I’ve been slowly building off of my map editor I made years ago. I’ve actually even dumped Pokemon Brown’s data and threw it into the game’s data folder and walked around the Pokemon Brown world haha.


I also use the Pokemon Red Disassembly project to find exactly how things work inside the game so everything is literally frame-accurate. Or it almost is. I try to force some delays to make my version more authentic. I’ve actually written a post about it.[/quote]
Where did you learn to get data from the roms?

Read full topic

item.title: Pokemon Multiplayer Red
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:19, topic:543679”]Are you decoding the data from Pokemon Red rom file?[/quote]I dump the data from ROMs, yes. I’ve been slowly building off of my map editor I made years ago. I’ve actually even dumped Pokemon Brown’s data and threw it into the game’s data folder and walked around the Pokemon Brown world haha.


I also use the Pokemon Red Disassembly project to find exactly how things work inside the game so everything is literally frame-accurate. Or it almost is. I try to force some delays to make my version more authentic. I’ve actually written a post about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Pokemon Multiplayer Red
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

There is a Pokémon Multiplayer Emulator somewhere downloadable that allows you to run a Pokémon GBA rom for multiplayer access. I’ve used it a long time ago. What you needed to do was download the Pokémon rom, open it up inside of the Game/Emulator, and then login with your credentials you used on the website. The clothing and look of the character was customizable. The sprites and town set-ups were loaded through the rom. I have an idea of how it works but I wouldn’t know how it is decrypted.

Read full topic

item.description:
@vortex wrote:

Looks really good, no combat yet though?
Your post totally made me want to attempt recreating Gold/Silver/Crystal again, heh.
Speaking of Gen 2, do you have the source code for the GBHL library you shipped with JohtoMap or do I have to decompile it ? I was thinking of using JohtoMap for learning the ROM format to dump the maps and all that.

Read full topic
